intro: Psilosiphon erongoensis, commonly known as the Erongo spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, glandular leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
